Posts.Content: Jun 15, 2009 08:14AM - edited Jun 15, 2009 01:45PM by blessedby4 Diagnosed with IDC May 8th, left mastectomy on June 1st and starting TCH chemo,  6 treatments on June 29th.  Herceptin for a whole year.  Not sure what to expect, everything has seemed so unreal.  Nothing has seemed that bad yet, not great but taking it all in stride, keep waiting for reality or whatever others seem to be feeling to hit sometime.  Not sure if chemo is what makes everything feel real and if that is the worse part of this cancer deal.  Two weeks out of surgery and feeling okay but uncomfortable on the left side with arm and expander in.  Am I just doing that well mentally or is there a point when all this really hits home?
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jul 15, 2009 04:48PM blessedby4 wrote: Renee:  Thanks so much for sharing your journey with your hair, your son did a wonderful job capturing the process and the emotions.  Just_Mary:  So sorry to hear of your problem but glad they did what they needed to do and now can continue to recover and have that behind you!  I also started chemo the 29th and go for my 2nd treatment next monday the 20th.  Try to stay positive as we will all get through this trying period in our lives. Thanks to all for your comments on the hair loss!  Mine is still coming out and I am amazed at how much can come out and yet I still have alot of hair on my head.  I am not waking up with hair all over my pillow yet so I am taking it one day at a time to decide when to shave it but will guess it should be within the next couple of days.  At the moment it doesn't seem to emotional for me but...I still have hair!  I will assume once it is all gone and I am looking at nothing on my head and a partial breast (under construction, ha!) maybe it will be time for a good cry.  I am not too emotional about alot of what has happened and not exactly sure why! MamaQ:  Laughed at your story of still putting a towel on your head after a shower.  I can see that easily happening!!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jul 9, 2009 05:03PM blessedby4 wrote: Waiting for the hair to start falling out!  What day did most of you experience this??  It seems like I remember some talking of some tingling going on the head prior to it falling out.  I am on day 12 after chemo and gearing up for round 2 on the 20th.  Not awful side effects, just alot of fatigue!!  MamaQ...had a friend who was that low on her wbc and they did nothing out of the ordinary for her.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2009 09:41AM blessedby4 wrote: Day 15 yesterday and the hair is starting to go!  Not coming out in clumps yet but definately is coming out.  Really strange to see!  Not sure as to when I should shave it.  When most of you shaved it, did you shave it down to the skin or did you leave some??  2nd TCH on Monday and interested in how this one effects me.  Went to the LGFB class last week and a little disappointed that they only focused on makeup and did not talk at all about scarves, wigs or hair issues.  Enjoyed the class and also had a lady their close to being done with her chemo and had the wig on and looked great in it! Thanks to all for sharing your journey!!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 28, 2009 08:11AM blessedby4 wrote: Start my 1st treatment TCH tomorrow and got the haircut short in anticipation of losing it all!  You all have had different reactions to treatment so not sure what I will experience but know something is coming!  Started the steroid's today and trying to keep drinking the water!  Have to say I am a little scared of starting tomorrow, just not sure what exactly to expect!  Enjoy reading your experiences...thanks for your support!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2009 03:39PM blessedby4 wrote: I had a left side mastectomy, stayed in the hospital for two days (probably could have gotten another day if I had wanted).  Slept in my bed on my back and right side and I had two drains.  I didn't even try the recliner because I don't sleep sitting up anywhere even in a car so I just slept as best I could in bed.  Good luck to you and this will all end soon for us all and hopefully life will get back to "normal".
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2009 08:08AM blessedby4 wrote: Candy... your words are encouraging and your determination to get through this is what we all need to have.    This is only a phase in our lives and having a good attitude is what I am trying to hold onto to get through this all.  I start my first TX in another week and a half and have port surgery next week!  Just trying to take each event in this as it comes and trying not to jump ahead.  It seems we will each experience SE differently so I hope I have the experience of the good side of things as so many of you have posted.  If not, I will obviously be pretty bummed but as the others,  we will get through this and look back on this period in our lives as only a memory!  Thanks for all the words of encouragement from you all!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Aug 17, 2009 01:17PM blessedby4 wrote: gjlanders:  Herceptin is a cancer drug given to those who are HER2+, which is only about 20% of breast cancers.  HER2+ breast cancer is another type of aggressive cancer that over produces the HER2 gene in our bodies.  The treatment if you are HER2+ is a full year of Herceptin given as an IV drug just like chemo drugs are given.  Our journey through the chemo is halfway done, hang in there!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2009 02:03PM blessedby4 wrote: glanders: Congratulations on getting your port out!  That in itself is an accomplishment to me!!  I look forward to that day! Hope you all have a good, relaxing weekend!!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Nov 1, 2009 03:18PM blessedby4 wrote: goldie34:  Welcome!  We are pretty much on the same schedule, I was also TCH (6) and finished 10-13 and now on Herceptin until next July.  I have had some eye twitching but was not associating with anything but who knows maybe it is from the treatments.  I have a lot of tearing from my eyes also and not sure if that could be related.  Have you noticed any se's with just the Herceptin??  I go for my first Herceptin only treatment tomorrow and am very anxious on seeing what I will experience.  The nurses tell me most don't have any se's but I know how individual this whole treatment process is!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Aug 16, 2009 08:19PM blessedby4 wrote: glanders and EngTchr:   I also have 3 more TCH to go and looking at mid October for being done with chemo then still to complete the full year of Herceptin which should take me through until next July!  I hear the Herceptin is not as bad as chemo just a lot of treatments.  Hope what they say applies to me!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jul 12, 2009 08:12AM blessedby4 wrote: Day 14 and no hair falling out yet!  No funny head sensations either.  The waiting is so hard...I keep touching my hair to see if any is coming out but none yet.  One week until round two and then as you all have experienced...here we go again!  Still trying to find some larger scarves in the stores but no sucess, will probably have to order some online.  Anyone prefer the cotton vs. silk?  Also still struggling with that this should be a life altering event that changes my perspective forever and just don't feel that way.  I guess I am taking it like it just happened and it's just one more life event that I need to get through and then life goes back to the daily "norm".  I guess I am kinda feeling bad that my attitude has not taken on a whole new life and feel like I am just the pre-cancer me that I was!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Oct 6, 2009 05:27PM blessedby4 wrote: Congratulations to all have finished their treatment!!  Hooray for you!!  I have one left to go next week and then continue on with Herceptin but at least I hear that it does not have the same se's that chemo had.  I am dealing with mouth sores after the last tx and not fun!!!  I have not posted much but kept up with all of you and have been thankful for all the information and feelings each of you has shared!   I think we all felt like this would never end but there is light at the end of this long tunnel!!!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Nov 2, 2009 06:21PM blessedby4 wrote: goldie34:  Got through my Herceptin treatment today with no problems.  I am just starting to feel some heartburn and I am really discouraged by this since this was my biggest se with chemo and I haven't had it in about a week and a half and thought I was through with that.  Now I am wondering if it could be a Herceptin se???  I guess I just have to wait it out and see if it continues.  Over all I don't think I had it as bad as some on TCH.  Had lots of heartburn/nausea, fatigue, mouth sores after treatment 5, and some various other se's through out the treatments but at least I was not getting sick to my stomach as some have experienced!  I hope you did not have that experience.  How exciting for you to get the expander out and get your implant!  Mine is scheduled for the end of November and looking forward to getting in my clothes again and being able to sleep on my left side or stomach!   Why are they having you do an MRI for your eye and facial sensation?  Do you know what they are possibly looking for?  Hope that comes out clear for you, definitely don't need one more thing to worry about!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jul 23, 2009 08:01AM blessedby4 wrote: Started losing my hair on day 15 after first TCH did not shave it yet!    4 days past 2nd tx and still have some hair  and not falling out as much as it was.  My question is to you all, do you think it will all fall out sometime soon or is it possible that it just thinned so much (I had thick hair) that this is all I will lose?  Don't know whether the 2nd tx will start it falling out again and have lost nothing on legs or anywhere else.  Does it still continue to fall after additional treatments?   It's driving me crazy to know whether I should shave it or think this could be all I lose.  I would not go out with out something on my head since it is too sparse on top but the sides have something there, just not much!  pjkappel:  My mastectomy was no where near as bad as I had heard from others experiences.  I was told  I would feel like a mack truck was sitting on my chest and I never felt that way!  It was uncomfortable but not so painful and my biggest problem was sleeping and having to actually see the site.  I told my doctors that the surgery was not at all like I had been told and I hope if you choose this option you experience the same thing!  Good luck to you!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Oct 20, 2009 05:40AM blessedby4 wrote: vickie614:  Congratulations on finishing chemo!!  How great that feels!!  Having more energy is what I also look forward to and feeling back to "normal".
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Oct 13, 2009 03:39PM blessedby4 wrote: Just finished my last chemo #6 today and now continue on with Herceptin every 3 weeks until next July.  One hurdle done, now have exchange surgery in about 6 weeks or so and hoping to have most of this behind me by the start of the new year. Hope your all doing well as we progress into the next phase of being cancer survivors!  Lots of emotions to deal with as we get past the treatments and back to a more "normal" life.  Let's allow ourselves to feel what we feel, the important part is not get stuck there!!

Polly, you are looking great!  I haven't gotten my 1st haircut yet, but thinking I may need to soon!  Kind of a change to have to start taking care of the hair again but a good change!! Hope you all are doing well June Chemo buddies!!

Posts.Content: Nov 24, 2009 02:17PM blessedby4 wrote: Icmag:  Congratulations getting done with chemo!!  Yippee!! greytmom:  Glad your surgery went well on Friday and you have that done with.  Did you have any implant put in on your "good" side or just the reduction and lift?  How are you feeling after that surgery?   I am still waiting for my exchange on the left side and a lift/tuck and small implant put in on right "healthy" side.  Was scheduled for surgery Friday and had to cancel today because I came down with one heck of a cold. :(   Still haven't decided on the nipple reconstruction yet but that will be done down the road if I do want it.
